predicate.note: Frames file for 'rule' based on survey of sentences in financial subcorpus, and comparison with 'decide'. Verbnet class dub-29.3, other members 'call' 'make' and 'name' have been framed.

roleset.name: decide

example.name: rule a sentence
example.text: In August, the commission ruled that between $190 million and $195 million of the plant's construction cost was unreasonable and should be refunded, plus interest.
example.arg: between $190 million and $195 million of the plant's construction cost was unreasonable and should be refunded, plus interest.

example.name: rule on
example.text: The commission is expected *trace* to rule on the Braidwood 2 case by year end.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: In a case involving Avondale Industries Inc. and its insurer, Travelers Cos., the Second U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in New York ruled in favor of the company on two issues that lawyers say are central to dozens of pollution cases around the country.
example.arg: In a case involving Avondale Industries Inc. and its insurer, Travelers Cos.
the Second U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in New York
two issues that lawyers say are central to dozens of pollution cases around the country.

roleset.note: In this last one the preposition is really (imho) "in favor of", but multi-word prepositions aren't recognized by anyone but me.

example.name: with attributive
example.text: The Supreme Court agreed to decide whether a federal court may dismantle a merger that *trace-1* has won regulatory approval but been ruled *trace-2* anticompetitive in a private suit.

example.name: not anymore
example.text: Paribas Chairman Michel Francois-Poncet wouldn't rule out *trace* eventually selling all of Navigation Mixte's insurance operations to Allianz.
example.arg: *trace* eventually selling all of Navigation Mixte's insurance operations to Allianz.
